name: Strawberry Goat Cheese Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Italian bread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'strawberries, washed and diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves, plus more for serving'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'goat cheese, room temperature'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground pepper to taste'}
steps: Heat vinegar in a small skillet over medium-low heat. Simmer until reduced by about half, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature.. Prepare a grill for high heat. Place bread slices on a foil-lined baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.. Combine strawberries and thyme in a small bowl and set aside.. Grill bread on the preheated grill until browned, about 3 minutes per side.. Spread goat cheese on toasted bread. Add black pepper, salt, and reduced vinegar to the strawberry mixture. Spoon over the goat cheese topped bruschetta. Garnish with additional thyme.

name: Tomato Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped red onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'fresh basil, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 pound) loaf', 'name': 'French bread, cut into 1/4-inch slices'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded mozzarella cheese'}
steps: Combine tomatoes, bell pepper, onion, balsamic vinegar, 1/4 cup olive oil, basil, and garlic; let tomato mixture rest for 15 to 30 minutes.. Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.. Arrange French bread slices on a large baking sheet; drizzle with 1/4 cup olive oil.. Toast bread in preheated oven until lightly browned, about 1 minute on each side. Top bread slices with tomato mixture using a slotted spoon, allowing excess liquid to drain. Return bread to baking sheet and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.. Broil in preheated oven until cheese melts, about 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Russian Tomato Salad Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thinly sliced sweet onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'thinly sliced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'thick slices', 'name': 'French bread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sliced fresh chives'}

name: DIY Bruschetta Bar Makes Entertaining Easy
Bruschetta with Shallots
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced shallots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, cut into slivers'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 pound) loaf', 'name': 'Italian bread, cut into 1/2 inch slices'}
steps: In a large bowl, toss together the roma tomatoes, minced garlic, shallots, basil, lemon juice, salt, pepper and 1/3 cup olive oil.. Place the slivered garlic and 1/4 cup olive oil in small saucepan over medium heat. Slowly cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes. Discard garlic.. Toast the bread slices, and brush with the olive oil heated with garlic. Top slices with the roma tomato mixture.

name: Tomato and Ricotta Salata Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'Italian bread, cut into 1/2-inch diagonal slices'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, halved'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'tomatoes, seeded and cut into 1/2-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) package', 'name': 'ricotta salata, cut into 1/2-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'finely chopped red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place bread slices on a baking sheet.. Bake in the preheated oven until toasted, about 5 minutes. Rub 1 side of the bread with the cut garlic.. Toss tomatoes, ricotta salata, olive oil, vinegar, onion, basil, salt, and pepper together in a bowl. Divide evenly over bread.

name: Bruschette al Lardo di Colonnata
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, halved, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh rosemary, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'crusty Italian bread, sliced and toasted'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'lardo (such as Lardo di Colonnata)'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground pink peppercorns to taste'}
steps: Mince 1 of the garlic halves and transfer to a bowl. Add tomatoes, rosemary, olive oil, red pepper flakes, and salt; mix well. Refrigerate tomato mixture for 1 hour.. Rub the remaining garlic half over each slice of bread. Spread lardo onto each slice and top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle ground pink peppercorns over tomato mixture.

name: Strawberry-Balsamic Ricotta Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mission® Artisan® Multigrain Tortillas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'part-skim ricotta cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'serving', 'name': 'non-stick cooking spray, as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sliced fresh strawberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'balsamic glaze'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'baby arugula'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'pine nuts, toasted'}
steps: Preheat a conventional oven to 400 degrees F.. Combine ricotta, honey, and salt in small mixing bowl; whisk to combine and set aside.. Coat tortillas evenly with non-stick spray. Place in single layer on baking pan and bake 8 to 10 minutes or until golden and crispy. Remove from oven and cut each tortilla into 4 equal strips; set aside to cool and crisp.. In second small mixing bowl, combine diced strawberries and chopped basil; set aside.. Spread ricotta mixture evenly across tortilla strips, drizzle each with balsamic glaze, layer with arugula greens, basil scented strawberries and a sprinkling of pine nuts.

name: Lazy Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Italian bread, 1/2 inch thick'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'garlic salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Italian cheese blend'}
steps: Preheat your oven's broiler.. Arrange the slices of bread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Mix together the olive oil and garlic powder in a cup or small bowl. Brush onto the slices of bread. Cover each piece of bread with tomato slices, then sprinkle with as much cheese as you like. Drizzle just a bit of the olive oil over the cheese.. Broil for 3 to 5 minutes, until cheese is melted and bread is toasted. Make sure you keep an eye on it - it doesn't take long!

name: Chef John's Grilled Swordfish Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cherry tomato halves'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'thinly sliced basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'French bread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'swordfish steaks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grapeseed oil'}
steps: Stir tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, basil, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl. Let sit until flavors blend, at least 30 minutes.. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Brush bread slices with olive oil.. Cook bread slices on the preheated grill until browned and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes per side.. Brush swordfish steaks with grapeseed oil and season with salt and black pepper.. Cook swordfish steaks on the preheated grill until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 4 minutes per side.. Divide bread slices between two plates and top each plate with 1 swordfish steak. Spoon 1/2 of the cherry tomato mixture over each steak.

name: Bruschetta with Mozzarella
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grape tomatoes, well drained'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese, cut into 1/4-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, pressed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '8 (1/2-inch thick)', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'baguette'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'fresh basil leaves for garnish (optional)'}
steps: Place tomatoes, mozzarella, sliced basil, garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and balsamic vinegar in a bowl, and fold until well combined. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Brush baguette slices with remaining olive oil until lightly coated. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet; season with salt. Broil until lightly browned, about 1 minute, being careful not to burn.. Spoon tomato mixture onto toasted baguette immediately before serving, and garnish with fresh basil leaves.

name: Balsamic Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'French bread, cut into ¼-inch slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'Parmesan cheese, freshly grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'good quality balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}

name: Ali's Amazing Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sweet onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(1 pound) loaf', 'name': 'Italian bread, cut into 1 inch slices'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly grated Parmesan cheese'}
steps: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).. In a medium bowl, combine tomatoes, onion, olive oil, oregano, basil and parsley. Place bread on a baking sheet, and top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan.. Bake in preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until bottom of bread is browned. Allow to cool 5 minutes before serving.

name: Italian-Style Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'plum tomatoes, seeded and cut into small dice'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely chopped red onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguette, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'high-quality balsamic vinegar, or to taste'}
steps: Combine tomatoes, 3 tablespoons olive oil, basil, red onion, garlic, red wine vinegar, and pepper in a bowl; let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes, then marinate in the refrigerator for 45 minutes.. Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.. Brush one side of Baguette slices with remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil; place, oiled-sides-up, onto a baking sheet.. Broil until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Spoon tomato mixture onto toasted Baguette slices; drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Serve immediately.

name: Easy Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguette, cut into 1/2 inch thick circles'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'plum tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}
steps: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).. Combine tomato, basil, and red onion in a small mixing bowl; stir well. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Set aside.. Arrange bread on a baking sheet. Place in oven, and bake until well toasted, approximately 5 minutes.. Remove bread from oven, and transfer to a large serving platter. Let bread cool 3 to 5 minutes. Rub garlic into the top of each slice of toast; the toast should glisten with the garlic. Spoon the tomato mixture generously onto each slice, and serve.

name: Double Tomato Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sun-dried tomatoes, packed in oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh basil, stems removed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguette'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded mozzarella cheese'}
steps: Preheat the oven on broiler setting.. In a large bowl, combine the roma tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, vinegar, basil, salt, and pepper. Allow the mixture to sit for 10 minutes.. Cut the baguette into 3/4-inch slices. On a baking sheet, arrange the baguette slices in a single layer. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes, until slightly brown.. Divide the tomato mixture evenly over the baguette slices. Top the slices with mozzarella cheese.. Broil for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.

name: Artichoke Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6.5 ounce) jar', 'name': 'marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Romano cheese'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped red onion'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguette, cut into 1/3 inch thick slices'}
steps: Preheat the broiler.. In a medium bowl, mix marinated artichoke hearts, Romano cheese, red onion and mayonnaise. Top French baguette slices with equal amounts of the artichoke heart mixture. Arrange slices in a single layer on a large baking sheet.. Broil in the preheated oven 2 minutes, or until toppings are bubbly and lightly browned.

name: Best Bruschetta Ever
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'seasoning salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: In a medium bowl, mix tomatoes, dried basil, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, garlic, seasoning salt and ground black pepper. Cover and chill in the refrigerator 8 hours, or overnight, before serving.

name: Bruschetta with Cheese
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguette'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced mozzarella cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced provolone cheese'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Slice baguette into 1/2-inch thick diagonal slices. Arrange slices in a single layer on a baking sheet. Brush both sides of each slice with olive oil. Place tomato slices and a sprinkling of basil and oregano on bread slices. Sprinkle tomatoes, basil, and oregano with garlic powder and white pepper. Cover tomato slices with mozzarella and provolone. Place more basil, oregano, and tomato slices on top of the cheese.. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is bubbly, 7 to 10 minutes.

name: Bruschetta al Pomodoro
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': None, 'name': 'Roma (plum) tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 pound) loaf', 'name': 'French or Italian-style bread'}
steps: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.. Combine tomatoes, basil, garlic, olive oil, oregano, pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper in a mixing bowl. Add more olive oil to coat entire mixture, if necessary. Set salsa aside for 10 minutes.. Slice bread into 1/2-inch-thick slices; arrange on a baking sheet in a single layer.. Broil in the preheated broiler until lightly browned, about 1 minute per side. Remove from broiler.. Spread tomato salsa on toasted bread slices; return to the oven. Broil until salsa is hot but not cooked, 2 to 3 minutes.

name: Caprese Garlic Bread
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) loaf', 'name': 'French bread'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'olive oil spray'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'salted butter'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'tomatoes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'balsamic glaze'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C), and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut bread in half lengthwise, lightly spray with olive oil, and place on the baking sheet, cut side up.. In a small bowl, combine butter and garlic; spread evenly on the bread halves, and top with mozzarella slices.. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, and bread edges are starting to brown, 8 to 11 minutes.. Remove from the oven, place tomato slices on top of the cheese, season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with basil. Drizzle with balsamic glaze, cut into slices, and serve.

name: Peach Brulee Burrata Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'herbes de Provence'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Italian bread, toasted'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'Burrata cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh freestone peach, cut into 12 slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'turbinado sugar'}
steps: Stir together herbes de Provence and sea salt in a small bowl. Set aside.. Top each slice toasted bread with a generous spread of Burrata cheese. Sprinkle cheese with a pinch of the herbes de Provence sea salt mixture. Set aside.. Lay peach slices flat in a single layer on a flame-proof surface or plate. Lightly sprinkle each slice with turbinado sugar. Using a kitchen torch set to a medium-low flame, melt the sugar by making short, even passes over the top of the sugar. Continue melting the sugar until it bubbles and turns dark brown, about 30 seconds. Place peach slice on each piece of toast and serve.

name: Mushroom and Tomato Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'Italian bread, cut into 3/4-inch thick slices'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'diced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, minced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded mozzarella cheese'}
steps: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet in a single layer.. Broil bread in the preheated oven until toasted, 1 to 2 minutes; watch carefully to prevent burning. Remove from the oven and place the baking sheet onto a wire rack. Keep the broiler on.. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, green onions, garlic, salt, black pepper, and parsley; cook and stir until mushrooms are soft and juicy, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat.. While the mushrooms are cooking, mix tomatoes and balsamic vinegar together in a bowl.. Top each toasted bread slice with mushroom mixture, then spread tomato mixture over top and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.. Return to the oven and broil until heated through and cheese has melted, about 5 minutes.

name: Bruschetta with Roasted Sweet Red Peppers
ingredients: {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'Italian bread'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) jar', 'name': 'marinated roasted sweet red peppers'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomato, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}
steps: Preheat your oven's broiler.. Slice bread loaf into 1-inch thick portions. Brush each slice on one side with olive oil. Broil, oil-side up, until barely golden. Remove from broiler pan and cool.. In a medium bowl, mix together roasted pepper, garlic, tomato, basil, and onion. Sprinkle mixture evenly on each toast portion. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Serve immediately.

name: Burrata Bruschetta with Figs
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Black Mission figs, halved lengthwise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'Burrata cheese, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(1/2 inch thick) slices', 'name': 'Italian bread, toasted'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sea salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate.. Place figs, skin-side down, on grill. Cook until figs start to swell and bubble, 2 to 4 minutes.. Whisk together balsamic vinegar and olive oil until completely combined, about 1 minute.. Place Burrata cheese on top of each piece of toast. Spread figs around bread and drizzle with balsamic vinegar mixture. Season with sea salt and black pepper to taste.

name: Strawberry Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'French baguette'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped fresh strawberries'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or as needed'}
steps: Preheat your oven's broiler. Spread a thin layer of butter on each slice of bread. Arrange bread slices in a single layer on a large baking sheet.. Place bread under the broiler for 1 to 2 minutes, just until lightly toasted. Spoon some chopped strawberries onto each piece of toast, then sprinkle sugar over the strawberries.. Place under the broiler again until sugar is caramelized, 3 to 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Papaya Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'papaya'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'Roma (plum) tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red bell pepper, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'mustard powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 inch)', 'name': 'French baguette, cut into 1/2 inch pieces'}
steps: Cut papaya in half and remove seeds. Reserve 2 tablespoons of seeds for the dressing. Peel and dice the papaya, and place in a medium bowl. Add tomatoes, red onion, red pepper and basil, and set aside.. In a food processor or blender, combine the papaya seeds, sugar, wine vinegar, oil, mustard and green onions. Process until smooth and thick, and most of the seeds have broken up. Pour over the papaya mixture and stir to coat all of the ingredients. Serve with slices of baguette.

name: Apple Goat Cheese Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled goat cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Fuji apple - peeled, cored, and chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'coarse ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'thin slices', 'name': 'French bread'}
steps: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack 3 to 4 inches from the heat source.. Toss together the goat cheese, apple, thyme, oregano, and pepper in a bowl; set aside. Arrange the bread slices on a baking sheet; toast the bread under the broiler until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes.. Sprinkle the goat cheese mixture evenly over the bread slices. Return bread to oven to broil until cheese is softened, about 1 minute more.

name: Mango Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 pound) loaf', 'name': 'French bread, cut into 1/2 inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'mango - peeled, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'fresh basil, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Romano cheese'}
steps: Preheat the broiler.. Arrange French bread slices in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Broil in the preheated oven 1 to 2 minutes per side, until lightly toasted. Remove from heat.. In a medium bowl, mix mango and fresh basil.. Top each bread slice with equal amounts of the mango and basil mixture. Sprinkle with Romano cheese, adjusting the amount to taste.. Return topped bread to broiler. Broil 2 to 3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and lightly browned. Serve hot.

name: Becca's Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'French bread, sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sweet onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2.25 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced black olives, drained'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}
steps: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Arrange the bread slices in a single layer on a baking sheet. In a bowl, mix the onion, garlic, olives, 2 tablespoons olive oil, oregano, basil, and parsley. Gently toss in the tomatoes. Top bread slices with the tomato mixture. Sprinkle with feta cheese and Parmesan cheese. Drizzle with remaining olive oil.. Bake 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cheese is melted and bread is lightly toasted.

name: Bruschetta with Peas and Mint
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'shallots, minced'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh or frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'ciabatta bread'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, peeled'}
steps: Melt butter in a skillet and cook shallots and peas until soft, but not browned, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until coarsely pureed. Mix in mint.. Cut ciabatta slices in half and drizzle with olive oil. Cut garlic in half and rub onto each slice.. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Place ciabatta slices on a baking sheet and toast in the oven until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.. Remove from oven and spread with pea mixture. Serve immediately.

name: Best Ever Bruschetta!
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'English muffins, split'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh tomatoes, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'black olives, pitted and halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese, halved'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source. Toast muffin halves under broiler until golden, about 2 to 3 minutes. Mix garlic, butter, and basil together in a small bowl; spread butter mixture evenly onto each toasted muffin half.. Combine tomatoes, olives, and tomato paste in a large bowl; set aside. Whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and honey in a small bowl. Spoon some of the tomato mixture onto each muffin, then drizzle the olive oil mixture over the top, place a piece of mozzarella on top, and season with salt and pepper.. Return muffins to broiler; cook until the cheese has melted, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Jen's Tomato Arugula Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'arugula - rinsed, dried and chopped'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, drained and chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}
steps: Bring 4 quarts of water to boil in a large saucepan. Place the roma tomatoes in the boiling water for about 1 minute to loosen the skins. Drain, and rinse with cold water. Peel, core, seed, and coarsely chop.. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Slowly cook and stir the tomatoes with salt and pepper for 15 minutes.. Stir in the garlic and cook 5 minutes. Stir the arugula into the mixture, then remove skillet from heat. Transfer mixture to a large bowl.. Gently fold the sun-dried tomatoes and Parmesan cheese into the mixture. Cover and chill in the refrigerator approximately 4 hours before serving.

name: Eggplant and Tomato Caponata
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Japanese eggplant, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': "fire-roasted tomatoes (such as Hunt's®)"}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'capers'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bay leaf'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; saute eggplant, onion, and garlic until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Add tomatoes, red wine, and capers and simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes.. Mix oregano, cinnamon, allspice, cocoa powder, sugar, and bay leaf into eggplant mixture; simmer until thickened, 30 minutes. Add a few tablespoons water if mixture becomes too thick. Remove bay leaf.

name: Caprese Grilled Bread
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguette, halved lengthwise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomato, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sprig', 'name': 'fresh parsley (Optional)'}
steps: Preheat an outdoor grill for low heat and lightly oil the grate.. Drizzle olive oil over baguette halves. Add minced garlic and season with salt and pepper. Layer tomato on top; season tomato with salt, pepper, dried parsley, and dried basil. Top tomato with mozzarella cheese.. Place baguette halves on foil and grill until cheese starts to melt, 5 to 8 minutes. Garnish with fresh basil and parsley. Cut into slices and serve.

name: Heirloom Tomato Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'small heirloom tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'truffle-infused olive oil (such as Olevano)'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguette, cut into 1-inch-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, peeled and halved'}
steps: Toss heirloom tomatoes with chopped basil, truffle oil, salt, and pepper. Set aside.. Heat olive oil in a large skillet; add chopped garlic. Cook baguette slices until browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Rub each side of the baguette with the halved garlic clove.. Spoon tomato mixture over the baguette slices.

name: Fantastic Fennel Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'sweet Bermuda onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fennel seed'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(20 ounce) loaf', 'name': 'French bread, sliced 1/2-inch thick'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, for brushing'}
steps: In a bowl, mix together the tomatoes, onion, garlic, fennel seed, basil, 1/3 cup olive oil, salt, and pepper. Chill for at least 1 hour to blend the flavors.. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Brush both sides of bread slices with some of the 1/4 cup of olive oil; place slices onto a baking sheet. Toast the bread until golden brown and crunchy on the outside, about 3 minutes per side. To serve, spoon the tomato mixture onto the toasted bruschetta and arrange on a serving platter.

name: Healthier Double Tomato Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'whole grain artisan bread, cut into 3/4-inch slices'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ready-to-eat sun-dried tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh basil, stems removed and leaves chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese'}
steps: Preheat the oven on broiler setting. Arrange the artisan bread slices in a single layer on a baking sheet.. Combine the roma tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, vinegar, basil, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Allow the mixture to sit for 10 minutes.. Broil the bread until slightly brown, about 1 to 2 minutes.. Divide the tomato mixture evenly over the bread slices. Top the slices with mozzarella cheese.. Return the baking sheet to the oven and broil until the cheese is melted, about 1 to 2 minutes.

name: Molletes
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'dried pinto beans'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'white whole wheat bread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded queso blanco'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chile-garlic sauce (such as Sriracha®)'}
steps: Place beans in a saucepan and add enough water to cover them by 1 inch. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Let stand for 1 hour.. Drain and rinse beans. Add enough fresh water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 2 hours. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water, and rinse.. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add beans and salt. Fry until beans are very soft, stirring and mashing frequently, 5 to 7 minutes.. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler on low heat.. Spread an equal amount of beans on each slice of bread and sprinkle queso on top. Place bread slices on a baking sheet.. Broil until beans are warmed and cheese is melted, about 3 minutes. Remove from oven and top with chile-garlic sauce.

name: Prosciutto Parmesan and Pine Nut Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'French baguettes, cut into 1/2 inch slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted pine nuts'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. In a medium bowl, cream the butter. Blend in prosciutto, Parmesan cheese and ground black pepper.. Place baguettes on a medium baking sheet. Heat in the preheated oven until lightly toasted, about 10 minutes.. Spread baguette slices with the butter mixture. Arrange on a large serving platter. Sprinkle with pine nuts.

name: Hunt's® Easy Tomato Bruschetta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': '(18-inch) French baguette, cut into 3/4-inch slices'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': "Hunt's® Petite Diced Tomatoes, drained"}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.. Place bread slices on a baking sheet. Brush tops with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly toasted.. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, drained tomatoes, basil, garlic, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.. Divide tomato mixture evenly over toasted bread. Serve immediately.
